intro: Anemone pulsatilla var. hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish globeflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features showy, saucer-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has a short, thick rhizome and hairy, palmately lobed leaves that are often bluish-green in appearance. It thrives in well-drained, alkaline soils and is often found in rocky or limestone-rich habitats. The flowers are pollinated by insects, and the plant is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
